abstract: Iran appoints Gholamali Khoshroo as substitute ambassador to United Nations, bowing to United States opposition to its original appointment of Hamid Aboutalebi; United States has accused Aboutalebi of aiding planners of 1979 Iranian hostage crisis.
lead_paragraph: An announcement of the appointment came nine months after the United States had made clear that Iran’s first choice, Hamid Aboutalebi, would never get a visa.
snippet: An announcement of the appointment came nine months after the United States had made clear that Iran’s first choice, Hamid Aboutalebi, would never get a visa.

headline.main: Iran Bows to Pressure in Naming U.N. Envoy
headline.print_headline: Iran Bows to Pressure in Naming U.N. Envoy
